subSections.title: Translingual
subSections.text:
{{Han stroke|Mainland China
[[File:今-bw.png|200px]]}} {{Han stroke|All regions except mainland China
[[File:今-tred.png|80px]]}}

subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In all regions except mainland China, the stroke between {{l|mul|𠆢}} and {{l|mul|㇇}} for <big>{{lang|mul|sc=Hant|今}}</big> (and its derived characters) is written with a horizontal {{l|mul|一}} line.
* In mainland China (based on ''{{w|Xin Zixing}}'' standardized form), the stroke between {{l|mul|𠆢}} and {{l|mul|㇇}} for <big>{{lang|mul|sc=Hans|今}}</big> (and its derived characters) is written with a slanting {{l|mul|丶}} dot instead.
* In the historical {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}, the component below {{l|mul|𠆢}} is written {{l|mul|一}} followed by {{l|mul|𠃍}} instead.

subSections.title: Chinese
subSections.text: {{zh-forms|alt=𫢉,⿱𠆢𬼽,⿱𠆢下}} <!-- Note: 𫝆 is Japanese alternative form, not Chinese. -->

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|i}} – in the mouth. The derivative {{och-l|含}} refers to the original word.
